response_requirements.initial_response_description: Custodian must provide records or deny request in writing within 3 working days; ground truth indicates 5 business days standard
response_requirements.final_response_notes: May extend by up to 7 additional working days if extenuating circumstances exist (total 10 days)
response_requirements.extension_notes: May extend by 7 working days with written notice stating reasons; must notify within initial 3-day period

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge research and retrieval fee if more than 1 hour of staff time necessary; first hour free; $33.58 per hour (2025 rate) for time exceeding one hour
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Reasonable copying fees permitted; varies by agency

exemptions.description: Medical records held by state institutions
Personnel files except name, compensation, title, dates of employment, and final administrative decisions on discipline/promotion/dismissal
Individual tax returns and return information
Trade secrets, privileged information, and confidential commercial, financial, geological, or geophysical data
Records relating to detection and investigation of crimes including reports, arrest records, witness statements, and investigation files
Work product of government attorney not discoverable under Colorado Rules of Civil Procedure
Public elementary and secondary school student records including addresses and telephone numbers

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Prior to judicial review, may file written request for reconsideration with custodian; may offer to meet and confer to discuss scope and basis of request
appeal_process.second_level_notes: Judicial review available in district court after reconsideration or directly
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award attorney fees to prevailing party

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Any person may inspect public records; no requirement to state purpose or identity
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written application required; must describe record with sufficient specificity to enable custodian to locate it
requester_requirements.specific_format: Must describe record with sufficient specificity to enable location

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Custodian responsible for records; no specific officer designation required
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Records maintained in electronic/digital form must be available in that form when technologically practicable
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Policy that all public records shall be open for inspection except as specifically provided

oversight_body.role: No specific oversight body; enforcement through courts

primary_sources: Colorado Revised Statutes Title 24, Article 72, Part 2
Colorado Open Records Act statutory text
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Colorado statute. Response timeline: 3 working days with 7-day extension allowed if extenuating circumstances (10 days total); ground truth indicates 5 business days standard. First hour of research/retrieval free; $33.58/hour thereafter (2025 rate). Written application required. May request reconsideration before judicial review. SB25-077 (which would have extended timeframes to 5+10 days) was VETOED by Governor Polis on April 17, 2025 citing transparency concerns. Electronic records must be available in electronic form when technologically practicable.
